thread.title: Lehigh men's basketball team picked to win Patriot League title
thread.title_full: Lehigh men's basketball team picked to win Patriot League title

author: Stephen Miller
title: Lehigh men's basketball team picked to win Patriot League title
text:
Lehigh men's basketball team picked to win Patriot League title Lehigh MICHAEL KUBEL / THE MORNING CALL Lehigh and sophomore guard Kahron Ross are the preseason pick to win the Patriot League title. Lehigh and sophomore guard Kahron Ross are the preseason pick to win the Patriot League title. (MICHAEL KUBEL / THE MORNING CALL) Stephen Miller Contact Reporter Of The Morning Call A Lehigh Valley program is the preseason pick to win the Patriot League men's basketball title. 
Lehigh edged Bucknell as the preseason pick to win the Patriot League men's basketball title, the league announced at its media day Thursday morning at ArtsQuest Center at SteelStacks. Defending league champion Lafayette was picked to finish sixth. 
Lehigh received 12 of the 20 first-place votes and 156 points overall. Bucknell received eight first-place votes and finished with 150 points. 
Boston University, Army, American, Lafayette, Loyola University Maryland, Holy Cross, Colgate and Navy rounded out the poll. 
Lehigh junior Tim Kempton, the league's 2014-15 player of the year, was picked as the league's preseason player of the year. Lafayette junior guard Nick Lindner also was selected for the five-player preseason all-league team. He was the Patriot League tournament MVP last year, when the Leopards won the title and advanced to the NCAA Tournament. 
All 10 Patriot League teams will open the season Nov. 13. League play opens Dec. 30, with the Patriot League tournament slated to open March 1. 
2015-16 Patriot League Preseason Poll Points 
1. Lehigh (12 first-place votes) 156 
2. Bucknell (8) 150 
4. Army West Point 108 
5. American 84
